```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = 'hide'}
## DATA GENERATION

dat = matrix(round(runif(4, 1, 100), 0), nrow = 2)

nc = colSums(dat)
nr = rowSums(dat)
nn = sum(dat)

# dat

chi = 0

for (i in 1:2) {
  for (j in 1:2) {
    fe = nc[i] * nr[j] / nn
    chi = chi + (dat[i, j] - fe)^2 / fe
  }
}


phi = sqrt(chi / nn)


# fet <- matrix(round(runif(2,1,10), 1), nrow = 2)
# mean <- matrix(round(runif(2,1,10), 1), nrow = 2)
# pc <- matrix(round(runif(2,1,10), 3), nrow = 2)
# 
# sol_round <- round(t(pc)%*%(fet-mean),2)[1,1]
# 
sol_round <- round(phi, 2)

```

Question
========

Suppose we have data on daily web-site visits for registered and non - registered users:

$$
\begin{array}{lrc} 
\text { Number of visits } & \text { Registered } & \text { Non-registered } \\
\hline \text { Less than 5 } & `r dat[1,1]` & `r dat[1,2]` \\
\text { More or equal to 5  } & `r dat[2,1]`  & `r dat[2,2]`
\end{array}
$$

Measure of the strength of association using phi coefficient.

Provide the answer with 2 decimal digits.
